Sentence.sentence: Even though the day-to-day experience of raising kids can be soul-crushingly hard, Senior writes that “the very things that in the moment dampen our moods can later be sources of intense gratification and delight.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But fewer students want to study humanities subjects: English departments awarded more bachelor’s degrees in 1970-1971 than they did 20 years later.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: During the late 1990s，national spending on social sciences and the humanities as a percentage of all research and development funds-including government, higher education, non-profit and corporate—varied from around 4% to 25%; in most European nations, it is about 15%.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Sometimes I feel in his late works a will to break all signs of continuity.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: In the late 1800s British archaeologist Sir Arthur Evans combed antique dealers’ stores in Athens, Greece.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: such dimensions of read suggest-as others introduced later in the book will also do-that we bring an implicit ( ' , often unacknowledged) agenda to any act of reading.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: On the assumption that they will become relevant later, you make a mental note of discourse entities as well as possible links between them.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Hill’s pressure later led to creation of national parks and green belts.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: His paternal grandparents, a steward and a housekeeper possessed even less status, having been servants, and Dickens later concealed their background.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: He taught himself shorthand to get an even better job later as a court stenographer and as a reporter in Parliament.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: We are still at the beginning of this revolution and small choices now may turn out to have gigantic consequences later.
Sentence.come: 出自-2018年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But in late September 2009, officials reported there was significant flu activity in almost every state and that virtually all the samples tested are the new swine flu, also known as A H1N1, not seasonal flu.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: During the late 1990s, national spending on social sciences and the humanities as a percentage of all research and development funds-including government, higher education, non-profit and corporate-varied from around 4% to 25%; in most European nations, i
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Emerging in the late sixties and reaching a peak in the Seventies, Land Art was one of a range of new forms, including Body Art,Performance Art, Action Art and Installation Art, which pushed art beyond the traditional confines of the studio and gallery.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: I came to recognise various signs of a bad paper: the kind of paper that purports to show that people who eat more than one kilo of broccoli a week were 1.17 times more likely than those who eat less to suffer late in life from pernicious anaemia.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: In the late 1800s British archaeologist sir Arthur Evans combed antique dealers'stores in Athens, Greece.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: It's not necessarily a bad thing, but depending on the school, it can be costly to make up credits after switching too late in the game.

Sentence.sentence: One survey found that bureaucratic delays led the average H-2A worker to arrive on the job 22 days late.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Researchers in the late 1960s discovered that humans are born with the capacity to approach challenges in four primary ways: analytically, procedurally, relationally and innovatively.
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The outbreak came to global notice in late April 2009, when Mexican authorities noted an unusually large number of hospitalizations and deaths among healthy adults.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: The pattern was observed by political scientist Andrew Hacker in the late 1970s.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

means.word_mean: 迟的, 晚的, 迟到的

sentences.en: We had a late dinner last night.
sentences.cn: 我们昨晚晚餐吃得很晚。

sentences.en: It's too late to go now.
sentences.cn: 现在去太迟了。

means.word_mean: 晚期的, 后期的, 接近末期的, 晚年的

sentences.en: The poet lived a happy life in his later life.
sentences.cn: 这位诗人晚年过着一种幸福的生活。

means.word_mean: 不久之前的, 最近的

sentences.en: The late storm did much harm.
sentences.cn: 不久以前的这场暴风雨造成了很大的灾害。

means.word_mean: 已故的, 最近去世的

sentences.en: Her late husband was an outstanding scientist.
sentences.cn: 她已故的丈夫是位杰出的科学家。

means.word_mean: 前任的

sentences.en: The visitor is the late President, now a scholar.
sentences.cn: 这位来访者是前总统, 现为学者。

means.word_mean: 新的

sentences.en: This is the late development of science.
sentences.cn: 这是科学的新发展。

means.word_mean: 近日暮的；近深夜的
迟, 晚

sentences.en: She married late in life.
sentences.cn: 她很晚才结婚。

means.word_mean: 接近末期

sentences.en: The bush was planted late in the season.
sentences.cn: 这灌木是在这个季节末期才栽种的。

means.word_mean: 临近日暮; 接近午夜, 到深夜

sentences.en: He worked late into night.
sentences.cn: 他工作到深夜。

means.word_mean: 不久前</seg>

data.mean: of late 最近；新近；近来

sentence.cn: 这样的人迟到是可以原谅的，但那些刻意迟到为了留下印象的人却不能。
sentence.en: Such a person may be forgiven if he is late,  but not those who are deliberately late to create impression.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 阅读理解 七选五 原文

sentence.cn: 20世纪80年代末，最后几只秃鹰在野外被捕获，现在有150多只秃鹰飞过加利福尼亚和附近的亚利桑那州、犹他州和墨西哥的巴哈。
sentence.en: In the late 1980s,  the last few condors were taken from the wild,  and there are now more than 150 flying over California and nearby Arizona,  Utah and Baja in Mexico.
sentence.from: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

means.word_mean: 迟到地;落后;慢地
其他释义
迟的;最近的;新的
其他释义

jx.jx_en_mean: no later than the time specified

lj.lj_ly: all new cars will be required to meet this standard by 1997 at the latest.
lj.lj_ls: 要求所有的新车最迟于1997年前达到这一标准。

phrase.cizu_name: late in the day (或 北美

jx.jx_en_mean: at a late stage in proceedings, especially too late to be useful

lj.lj_ly: you've realized it a little late in the day.
lj.lj_ls: 你已经认识到了，不过为时已晚。

entry.def: Late means near the end of a day, week, year, or other period of time.

example.ex: It was late in the afternoon...
example.tran: 那是下午近黄昏的时候。

example.ex: She had to work late at night...

entry.def: If it is late, it is near the end of the day or it is past the time that you feel something should have been done.
entry.tran: 近日暮的；近深夜的；时间不早的

example.ex: It was very late and the streets were deserted...
example.tran: 时间已很晚，街上空空荡荡。

example.ex: We've got to go now. It's getting late.
example.tran: 我们得走了。时候不早了。

entry.def: Late means after the time that was arranged or expected.

example.ex: The talks began some fifteen minutes late...
example.tran: 会谈晚了大概15分钟才开始。

entry.def: Late means after the usual time that a particular event or activity happens.

example.ex: We went to bed very late...

entry.def: You use late when you are talking about someone who is dead, especially someone who has died recently.
entry.tran: 已故的；已逝的；（尤指）新近去世的

entry.def: Someone who is late of a particular place or institution lived or worked there until recently.
entry.tran: 在…居住（或工作）直至最近的

example.tran: 直到不久前还住在贝尔邬大道的表兄扎卡里
刚离开《时代》杂志不久的斯特罗布·塔尔博特

entry.def: If you say better late than never when someone has done something, you think they should have done it earlier.
entry.tran: 迟到好过没到；晚做好过不做

example.ex: It's been a long time coming but better late than never.
example.tran: 早就该如此了。不过，也总比没有的强。

entry.def: If you say that someone is doing something late in the day, you mean that their action or behaviour may not be fully effective because they have waited too long before doing it.

example.ex: I'd left it all too late in the day to get anywhere with these strategies.
example.tran: 我按兵不动时间太长，致使这些策略都不管用了。

entry.def: You use of late to refer to an event or state of affairs that happened or began to exist a short time ago.

example.ex: His life has changed of late...
example.tran: 他的生活近来发生了变化。

example.ex: The dollar has been stronger of late.

entry.def: If an action or event is too late, it is useless or ineffective because it occurs after the best time for it.

example.ex: It was too late to turn back...
We realized too late that we were caught like rats in a trap.
example.tran: 等我们发觉自己已成瓮中之鳖时已经太晚了。

means.word_mean: 1. being or occurring at an advanced period of time or after a usual or expected time;
2. after the expected or usual time; delayed;

sentences.sentence: "tardy children are sent to the principal"

means.word_mean: 3. of the immediate past or just previous to the present time;
4. having died recently;
5. of a later stage in the development of a language or literature; used especially of dead languages;
6. at or toward an end or late period or stage of development;

sentences.sentence: "later medical science could have saved the child"

means.word_mean: 7. (used especially of persons) of the immediate past;

sentences.sentence: "our late President is still very active"
"the previous occupant of the White House"

means.word_mean: 1. later than usual or than expected;

sentences.sentence: "notice came so tardily that we almost missed the deadline"
"I belatedly wished her a happy birthday"

means.word_mean: 2. to an advanced time;
3. at an advanced age or stage;

sentences.sentence: "undertook the project late in her career"

means.word_mean: 4. in the recent past;

sentences.sentence: "as late as yesterday she was fine"
"the spelling was first affected, but latterly the meaning also"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English læt (adjective; also in the senseslow, tardy), late (adverb), of Germanic origin; related to German lass, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin lassus 'weary', let, and let

sentences.en: In later life he started playing golf.

sentences.cn: 这所学校建于20世纪70年代末。
sentences.en: The school was built in the late 1970s.

sentences.cn: 对不起，我迟到了。
sentences.en: I'm sorry I'm late.

sentences.en: She's late for work every day.

sentences.en: My flight was an hour late.

sentences.cn: 我们对本趟列车的晚点表示歉意。
sentences.en: We apologize for the late arrival of this train.

sentences.cn: 因天气寒冷，农作物今年成熟得晚。
sentences.en: Because of the cold weather the crops are later this year.

sentences.cn: 逾期付款必须支付利息。
sentences.en: Interest will be charged for late payment.

sentences.cn: 现在插播刚刚收到的新闻。
sentences.en: Here is a late news flash.

sentences.cn: 那是下午近黄昏的时候。

sentences.cn: 她不得不深夜工作。
sentences.en: She had to work late at night...

sentences.cn: 时间已很晚，街上空空荡荡。
sentences.en: It was very late and the streets were deserted...

sentences.cn: 我们得走了。时候不早了。

sentences.cn: 史蒂夫迟到了。
sentences.en: Steve arrived late...

sentences.cn: 会谈晚了大概15分钟才开始。
sentences.en: The talks began some fifteen minutes late...

sentences.cn: 我们很晚才睡。
sentences.en: We went to bed very late...

sentences.cn: 他结婚晚。
sentences.en: He married late.

sentences.cn: 我已故的丈夫
sentences.en: ...my late husband.

sentences.cn: 已故的帕金先生
sentences.en: ...the late Mr Parkin.

sentences.cn: 直到不久前还住在贝尔邬大道的表兄扎卡里
sentences.en: ...Cousin Zachary, late of Bellevue Avenue.

sentences.cn: 刚离开《时代》杂志不久的斯特罗布·塔尔博特
sentences.en: ...Strobe Talbott, late of Time magazine.

sentences.cn: 早就该如此了。不过，也总比没有的强。
sentences.en: It's been a long time coming but better late than never.

sentences.cn: 我按兵不动时间太长，致使这些策略都不管用了。
sentences.en: I'd left it all too late in the day to get anywhere with these strategies.

sentences.cn: 他的生活近来发生了变化。
sentences.en: His life has changed of late...

sentences.cn: 美元近来走势强劲。
sentences.en: The dollar has been stronger of late.

sentences.cn: 回头已经太晚了。
sentences.en: It was too late to turn back...

sentences.cn: 等我们发觉自己已成瓮中之鳖时已经太晚了。
sentences.en: We realized too late that we were caught like rats in a trap.

sentences.cn: 最晚的预约时间是几点钟？
sentences.en: What is the latest time I can have an appointment?

sentences.cn: 在新年前夜，俄罗斯人的就寝时间是全世界最晚的，大概要到凌晨3 点30 分才上床睡觉。
sentences.en: On New Year’s Eve, Russians have the world’s latest bedtime, hitting the hay at around 3:30 a.m.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 那么他有没有晚上回家很晚的时候?
sentences.en: And does he ever home late at night?

sentences.cn: 我们准备10点钟离开, 你若晚的话倒霉!
sentences.en: We're leaving at ten o'clock, and woe betide you if you're late!

sentences.cn: B好主意. 不管怎样, 不要担心——我们不会在外面呆得太晚的.
sentences.en: B Good idea. Anyway, don't worry – we won't stay out too late.

sentences.cn: 提姆西11岁才开始学游泳, 起步算是比较晚的.
sentences.en: Timothy started swimming at 11, relatively late.

sentences.cn: 我们一直谈到很晚的时候.
sentences.en: We continued talking till late.

sentences.cn: 对于你方到了这么晚的时期还认为有必要提出这一要求, 我们感到遗憾.
sentences.en: We regret that you find it necessary to make this request, especially at this late stage.

sentences.cn: A10点前 怎么样 ?我不会去太晚的.
sentences.en: A How about just before 10? I won't be late.

sentences.cn: 他将食物带给晚上城市中工作到很晚的人.
sentences.en: He brought food to men who worked late at night in the city.

sentences.cn: 全家在除夕夜聚餐,并且会熬夜到很晚的时候.
sentences.en: Families dine together on New Year's Eve and stay up very late.

sentences.cn: 你是来得最晚的, 但我想,你是最美的.
sentences.en: You are more at the latest, but I think that you are the most beautiful.

sentences.cn: 我有时会在快到傍晚的时候醒来,嘴里有一股不舒服的味道.
sentences.en: I woke up late afternoon sometime with a funny taste in my mouth.

sentences.cn: 谁会在这么晚的时间来拜访我 呢 ?
sentences.en: Who can be calling on me at this late hour?

sentences.cn: 我们很抱歉,在这样晚的时候把你拉到这里来.
sentences.en: We are sorry to drag you here at such a late hour.

sentences.cn: 伦敦中心的商店星期二晚上一直营业到很晚的时候.
sentences.en: The shops in central London keep open late on Tuesday evenings.

sentences.cn: 看起来她的新电影必将在今晚的电影节上大获全胜.
sentences.en: Her latest film looks set to sweep the board at tonight's cinema awards.

sentences.cn: “ 我们如果马上就走, 一点都不会晚的. ” 她固执地大声说.
sentences.en: " We won't be late if we start now,'she insisted aloud.

sentences.cn: 她设法解释她为什么在外面呆这么晚的原因.
sentences.en: She tried to explain why she had stayed out so late.

sentences.cn: 深夏夜晚的天空在昏暗的光线里显得很低.
sentences.en: The grey light of a late summer's evening lowered a damp sky.

sentences.cn: 那就是他来晚的原因.
sentences.en: That is the reason why he came late.

sentences.cn: 当我们走出黑暗隧道的那一瞬间,临近傍晚的阳光依然耀眼.
sentences.en: Blinking in the late afternoon light, we emerge from the dark tunnel.

sentences.cn: 有天晚上他很晚的时候急匆匆的来按我家门铃.
sentences.en: He rang the bell of my house with a rush late at night.

sentences.cn: “ 为午后傍晚的廊桥,或者更恰当地说, 为在温暖的红色晨光里的廊桥. ”
sentences.en: " To covered bridges in the late afternoon or, better yet, on warm, red mornings. "
sentences.from: 英汉文学 - 廊桥遗梦

sentences.cn: 嗯, 他俩单独在下午很晚的时候乘一辆轻便马车出去了,连个女伴都没有.
sentences.en: Well, he took her out buggy riding in the late afternoon without a chaperon!

sentences.cn: 傍晚的时候它们又穿过这条路回到树林里去.
sentences.en: Later in the day, they cross the road again to go to the woods.

sentences.cn: 来晚的人们不许入内观看演出.
sentences.en: Those who arrives late will find himself shut out of the performance.

sentences.cn: 现在就出去然后告诉他们你有多爱他们在这还不算太晚的时候.
sentences.en: Now go out there and show them that you love them before it's too late.

sentences.cn: 女：你和那个迟到的人谈过了吗？。
sentences.en: W: Have you spoken to the man who was late?.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 男：我在想，你能不能见一下Smith，也就是那个迟到的员工，毕竟你在处理此类事情上比我强得多。
sentences.en: M: I was wondering if you’d see Smith, the man who was late,  because you are so much better at handling things like this.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 根据女士所述，迟到的印刷操作员将会受到什么惩罚？。
sentences.en: What will happen to the press operator who was late for work according to the woman?.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 男士为何建议女士约见迟到的员工？。
sentences.en: Why does the man suggest the woman see the worker who was late?.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 汤姆找不到充分的理由说明迟到的原因.
sentences.en: Tom can not find a good excuse for being late.

sentences.cn: 如果比尔再迟到的话, 我就得和他谈谈了.
sentences.en: If Bill is late again, I'll tackle him about it.

sentences.cn: 经理要我申说一下这次迟到的原因.
sentences.en: The manager asked me to explain why I was late.

sentences.cn: 凡是迟到的都将发现自己不得进入音乐会场.
sentences.en: Anyone who arrives late will find himself shut out of the concert.

sentences.cn: 我还以为我会迟到的哩.
sentences.en: I thought I should be late.

sentences.cn: 让汤姆解释他为什么迟到的原因.
sentences.en: Let Tom explain why he was late.

sentences.cn: 他迟到的借口是无法使人相信的.
sentences.en: His excuse for being late was very thin.

sentences.cn: 若迟到的是她, 她会说女孩子迟到是理所当然的.
sentences.en: If she is late, she says that's a girl's way.

sentences.cn: 不要掉队, 你要让大家都迟到的.
sentences.en: Don't drag behind others, you'll make us all late.

sentences.cn: 迟到的同学请在午餐后至中走廊集合.
sentences.en: Students who were late for school, please assemble in the main foyer after lunch.

sentences.cn: 那声迟到的仁慈的叹息带来的恩惠.
sentences.en: The boon of one too late relenting sigh.

sentences.cn: 知道自己要迟到的人们经常会提前打电话告诉对方自己会晚到.
sentences.en: People who are running late often call ahead to let the others know of the delay.

sentences.cn: 他迟到的理由是没有赶上火车.
sentences.en: His excuse for being late was that he had missed the train.

sentences.cn: 再去叫麦克下楼, 他上班要迟到的.
sentences.en: Call Mike down again, he'll be late for work.

sentences.cn: 山姆:我不敢相信老板还在讲大家上班迟到的事.
sentences.en: I can't believe the boss is still talking about people coming in late.

sentences.cn: 特里萨: 你准备好了, 椒芬? 我们要迟到的毕业.
sentences.en: Theresa : Are you ready to go, Fanny? We'll be late for the graduation.

sentences.cn: 假定别人不迟到的话,我们可以一起离开.
sentences.en: We can all leave together assuming that the others aren't late.

sentences.cn: 他为迟到的事向老师表示了歉意.
sentences.en: He apologized to the teacher for being late.

sentences.cn: 很难保证他不会迟到,他按时到或迟到的可能性一样大.
sentences.en: It's even odds that he'll be late.

sentences.cn: 快点, 否则你会迟到的.
sentences.en: Hurry up, or you'll be late.

sentences.cn: 等候迟到的人使我们厌烦.
sentences.en: It irks us to wait for people who are late.

sentences.cn: 他是那种经常迟到的人.
sentences.en: He is the kind who always arrives late.

sentences.cn: 约翰迟到的时候, 我要他解释一下.
sentences.en: When John was late, I asked him for an explanation.

sentences.cn: 让他解释他为什么迟到的原因.
sentences.en: Let him explain why he was late.

sentences.cn: 客人: 他们就是迟到的那两位.
sentences.en: Customer: They are the ones who are late.

sentences.cn: 当一个老师迟到的时候, 他就会在大厅遇到校长.
sentences.en: When the instructor is late, he will meet the principal in the hall.

sentences.cn: 她已故的丈夫
sentences.en: her late husband

sentences.cn: 已故的弗雷迪·默丘利
sentences.en: the late Freddie Mercury

sentences.cn: 我已故的丈夫
sentences.en: ...my late husband.

sentences.cn: 已故的帕金先生
sentences.en: ...the late Mr Parkin.

sentences.cn: 哈佛大学已故的Richard Hackman 曾表示：“毫无疑问，团队有可能创造奇迹，催生出非凡的事物……④但是不能太依赖团队。”
sentences.en: The late Richard Hackman of Harvard University once argued, “I have no question that when you have a team, the possibility exists that it will generate magic,producing something extraordinary… ④ But don’t count on it.”
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 他兴办那个慈善机构以纪念他已故的妻子.
sentences.en: He founded the charity in memory of his late wife.

sentences.cn: 玛丽的已故的丈夫曾是个法官, 她把他的锤子一直放在壁炉上.
sentences.en: Mary's late husband had been a judge, and she kept his gavel on the mantelpiece.

sentences.cn: 每次她一提到已故的丈夫就会泪流满面.
sentences.en: She can't talk about her late husband without crying.

sentences.cn: 他是一个已故的化学教授的独子.
sentences.en: He was the only son of a late professor of chemistry.

sentences.cn: 她已故的丈夫是位杰出的科学家.
sentences.en: Her late husband was an outstanding scientist.

sentences.cn: (那位坐在长椅上的老先生长得很像我已故的祖父. )
